Memorandum by the Chancellor of the Exchequer.A Bill confirming the Customs Resolutions of the Manx legislature is passed annually.The Isle of Man has a separate financial existence, levying its own taxes and defraying its own expenditure., In particular it is completely free as to Customs daties, subject to confirmation hy the Imperial Parliament. It would he unprecedented for Parliament to alter the duties.The effect of the Resolutions to he confirmed hy this Bill is to continue certain duties which are imposed in the Island annually and to apply to the Isle of Man the modifications in the Customs tariff that are made in this country hy the Financial Bill in the case of goods (other than sugar which is not dutiable in the Isle of Man) chargeable with duties under enactments other than the Import Duties Ac be Duties under the Import Duties Act are imposed in the Isle of Man hy statutory order not requiring confirmation ex post facto hy the Imperial Parliament.The Bill is practically formal and usually occupies very little Parliamentary time,. There is no reason to anticipate any discussion this year. Authority is requested to introduce the Bill immediately and to proceedSECRET. CP. 175 (57). with it at once, subject to any drafting or other minor amendments that may he found necessary. In view of the nature of the Bill and the shortness of the time available, the Prime Minister has approved its circulation to the Cabinet without prior consideration by the Home Affairs Committeea.
